content.text: Bash free Command - Display Free and Used Memory
Using the free Command
The free command is used to display the amount of free and used memory in the system.
content.html: The free command is used to display the amount of free and used memory in the system.

content.text: It's useful for monitoring memory usage and managing system resources.
content.html: It's useful for monitoring memory usage and managing system resources.

content.text: Basic Usage
To display memory usage, use free :
content.html: To display memory usage, use free:

content.code:
free
-k
total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:        8176588     1376568     5869188      146532     1051172     6352280
Swap:       2097148           0     2097148
content.code_html:
free -k
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:        8176588     1376568     5869188      146532     1051172     6352280
Swap:       2097148           0     2097148

content.text: Options
The free command has options to change how it works:
content.html: The free command has options to change how it works:

content.text: Show Memory in Human-Readable Format
The -h option allows you to show memory in a human-readable format, such as KB, MB, or GB.
content.html: The -h option allows you to show memory in a human-readable format, such as KB, MB, or GB.

content.text: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.
content.html: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.

content.code:
free
-h
total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:           7.8G        1.3G        5.6G        142M        1.0G        6.1G
Swap:          2.0G          0B        2.0G
content.code_html:
free -h
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:           7.8G        1.3G        5.6G        142M        1.0G        6.1G
Swap:          2.0G          0B        2.0G

content.text: Show Memory in Bytes
The -b option allows you to show memory in bytes, providing a more precise measurement.
content.html: The -b option allows you to show memory in bytes, providing a more precise measurement.

content.text: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.
content.html: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.

content.code_html:
free -b
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:     8374145024   1409286144   6008344576    149946368   1076512768   6563766272
Swap:    2147479552           0   2147479552

content.text: Show Memory in Kilobytes
The -k option allows you to show memory in kilobytes.
content.html: The -k option allows you to show memory in kilobytes.

content.text: This is the default behavior of the free command.
content.html: This is the default behavior of the free command.

content.code:
free
-k
total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:        8176588     1376568     5869188      146532     1051172     6352280
Swap:       2097148           0     2097148
content.code_html:
free -k
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:        8176588     1376568     5869188      146532     1051172     6352280
Swap:       2097148           0     2097148

content.text: Show Memory in Megabytes
The -m option allows you to show memory in megabytes, which can be easier to read for larger memory sizes.
content.html: The -m option allows you to show memory in megabytes, which can be easier to read for larger memory sizes.

content.text: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.
content.html: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.

content.code:
free
-m
total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:           7985        1344        5730         143        1026        6199
Swap:          2047           0        2047
content.code_html:
free -m
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:           7985        1344        5730         143        1026        6199
Swap:          2047           0        2047

content.text: Show Memory in Gigabytes
The -g option allows you to show memory in gigabytes, which is useful for systems with large amounts of memory.
content.html: The -g option allows you to show memory in gigabytes, which is useful for systems with large amounts of memory.

content.text: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.
content.html: Without this option, memory is displayed in kilobytes by default.

content.code:
free
-g
total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:              7           1           5           0           1           6
Swap:             1           0           1
content.code_html:
free -g
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:              7           1           5           0           1           6
Swap:             1           0           1

content.text: Continuously Display Memory Usage
The -s option allows you to continuously display memory usage at specified intervals. This is useful for monitoring memory usage over time.
content.html: The -s option allows you to continuously display memory usage at specified intervals. This is useful for monitoring memory usage over time.

content.code_html: free -s 5

content.text: Display Total Memory
The -t option includes a line showing the total memory (used + free) for both RAM and swap. This provides a quick overview of total memory resources.
content.html: The -t option includes a line showing the total memory (used + free) for both RAM and swap. This provides a quick overview of total memory resources.

content.code_html:
free -t
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:        8176588     1376568     5869188      146532     1051172     6352280
Swap:       2097148           0     2097148
Total:     10273736     1376568     7966336
